Reviews.Title: “Personel hardly speak english”
Reviews.Author: tyggrysio
Reviews.Content: Room was small but clean. Breakfast was OK. There was a free parking place in the backyard and a free wifi in the room. The big disadvantage was that staff hardly speak english. And one has to pay in cash.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ladyingreen75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a 5 night sightseeing break - our first in Berlin. First impressions were not good; we were on the third floor and there is no lift so check with the manager before booking if stairs are a problem. The rooms were very basic, certainly not like the one pictured on the website, very small bathroom and TV only in German (yes I know its Germany but most hotels we have stayed in abroad pick up satellite channels from other European countries) but it was clean and our request for extra pillows was dealt with promptly. On the downside we had 2 rooms, one on the back of the building and one on the front. The room on the front was very noisy right into the small hours with nearby trams and other traffic and passing revellers. The widow had very efficient double glazing but the weather was hot during our visit and the room was too hot at night with the window shut. On the plus side, the breakfast surpassed our expectations with a large and varied cold buffet and there were lots of restaurants nearby for an evening meal. It was well situated for walking to lots of the sights and the U-Bahn station was just a few minutes walk away. We travelled by train on 2 occasions and found it chewap and easy to use. Although we have criticised the hotel to some extent the price of Eu85 per night room, and breakfast is very reasonable for a city centre and we feel we had valus for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience thanks to the location and staff”
Reviews.Author: TheGiorgis
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic--with little cafes all around and the train station just across the street. Very centrally-located. The price was fantastic and much better than other hotels in the area. But what really made our stay great was the VERY friendly and helpful Ukrainian receptionist. She doesn't speak much English and I don't speak a word of German but we were able to understand each other. I arrived before my husband and wanted to greet him at the airport, so I asked about taxis outside. She said--in German, which I don't speak--to take the train and then the connecting bus, which is 2.10 EU as opposed to a 20 EU taxi. She cut out a train schedule for me, explained the whole thing about 3 times until I understood, and she was so excited when I came back from my successful trip to the airport. It was one of those international vacation experiences that really makes your trip. And to top it off, since I ended up choosing a smaller room when I got there because of the view, they charged me less than what they originally quoted me!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but the rooms are just about OK”
Reviews.Author: TheDreamGod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to a S-bahn and an U-bahn stations - very well connected and in addition the quarter is a very lively place. The ambulance cafe across the street provides free wifi and excellent food & hot drinks, and there are many nice food places nearby. Now back to the hotel - the staff is polite and helpful to the guests but they were occasionally yelling at each other. The furniture in the rooms was not very new, and we were unlucky to have a very stinky bathroom. The breakfast was nice. I'd recommend it for its location and not too high price.

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms, friendly reception and nice breaky.”
Reviews.Author: fairyprincess_007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in the winter that is Berlin! The staff speak little English but are friendly none the less. It's an older hotel however it's neat and clean and there's plenty of room to spread out in the rooms. No internet however we could reach the internet from the care across the road (Espresso Ambulance) go get a coffee and the password and you'll be right if you have a window facing that way. Breakfast was the usual meats, cheeses, breads, yoghurts and was very good. Lots of great restaurants in this area which made eating out a pleasure. There's also a subway station right outside the place. We opted for a taxi from the Hauptbahnhof which cost about 7 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: ektorasAthens
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful people. Excellent location right in the middle of MITTE! Great breakfast. Very clean and quite. We will definetely stay here when again in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming, centrally located, with wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GemimaScotland
Reviews.Content: This was a 4 day visit for me and my student son. I booked over the phone as I speak some German. Some of the staff speak English though. We both thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Both of us decided that the breakfast was the best we have ever had in all our travels around the Continent. A delicious variety of cheeses,hams,eggs,smoked salmon,breads, rolls & cake, a big bowl of freshly made fruit salad and plenty of tea and coffee. It kept us going for the day! The room was clean and comfortable with an ensuite shower and toilet situated at the back of the building so was quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the location is very central. I would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place”
Reviews.Author: DjsTrip
Reviews.Content: Think "bed and breakfast", right in the heart of Berlin. I completely stumbled across this place, and could not have been happier with my stay. The woman who works at the reception desk, (and handles the breakfast etc) doesn't speak English, but is more than happy to play charades with you until you both figure out what you need. The rooms are clean, and very spacious. For an extra 5 euro, the breakfast was fantastic, which included smoked salmon and caviar. Free cookies at the front desk - how can you go wrong with free cookies. At about 70 euro per night with breakfast, I was very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Doogster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Year and we couldn't have been happier with it. It's very cheap for such a good location so don't expect designer decor but it's very clean. We were given several sets of keys when we arrived to choose our own rooms which has never happened anywhere before! Agree that the breakfasts are great value - and even if you sleep in they can give you something. I even got a call asking me if I wanted anything when I didn't show one morning. Non German speakers may panic a wee bit as the staff spoke no English when we were there but they seem to make themselves understood. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: leghzielelias
Reviews.Content: We passed a very nice period in the Markisher Hof hotel. First of all, this hotel, is located pretty well, because it's only 100m from the Oranienburger Tor subway. --------------------------------------------------------------- The rooms are very clean, and the housekeeping was really wonderfull. I thought to find some problems with the language, from the moment that I don't speak german, but there was Joseph that spoke a clear and reliable english. I strongly reccomend this hotel to young people and also for a family-stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, convenient and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at the Markischer Hof back in July/2000 while attending a conference at Humboldt University and really enjoyed my stay there. The hotel is conveniently located on the Mitte area, with very easy access to the subway station and to the tram, and withing walking distance to Alexander Platz and other points of attraction. I had a double room for single use; though it was not large (and on the second floor, which meant two flights of stairs to climb carrying suitcases), it was very clean and confortable, with a mini-bar that could be locked, a nice shower box, and windows that opened. One of the best things about the Hotel was the breakfast (included in room rate): all kinds of marvelous bread and rolls, delicious cold cuts and cheeses of different kinds, great butter and jams, your choice of eggs, and good coffee (I gained a few extra lbs theres...). To top if off, the staff - all women - was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Markischer Hof, Good value”
Reviews.Author: Travelator2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Markischer Hof in March 2005. The staff were friendly, and our en-suite room (on the second floor at the back of the hotel) was quiet and comfortable. The location is very handy: trams stop just outside, and the Oranienburger Tor U-bahn station is just a few metres away (very convenient for the U-bahn to Kurt-Schumacher Platz, from which which the 128 bus runs to Tegel airport). There are lots of nice restaurants nearby on Oranienburger Strasse, and good access to all city attractions. All in all, a great location and good value for the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Berlin Markischer Hof am Tacheles
HotelInfo.Address: Linienstrasse 133 | Mitte, 10115 Berlin, Germany
